meanings.definition: A cone-shaped device used to amplify sound.
meanings.sent1: During the game, the cheerleader used megaphones to make her voice louder.
meanings.sent2: The lifeguard used megaphones to alert swimmers of the approaching storm.
meanings.sent3: The megaphones at the rally made the speaker's voice sound like a booming giant.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed through the room like a chorus of megaphones.
meanings.sent5: The megaphones in the stadium made the announcements crystal clear to everyone.

meanings.definition: To speak through a megaphone to make one's voice louder.
meanings.sent1: He decided to megaphone his message to the crowd to ensure they all heard him.
meanings.sent2: The coach megaphoned instructions to the players on the field.
meanings.sent3: She playfully megaphoned her order at the drive-thru, much to the cashier's amusement.
meanings.sent4: His words megaphoned across the empty street, reaching even the farthest corners.
meanings.sent5: The teacher megaphoned the question so all students could participate in the discussion.
